history.content: No, transfer units don't count towards the unit ceiling and you do not have to declare during your first semester. Only the semesters you spend at Cal count towards the semester limit. You will have to submit a form if you wish to move your expected graduation date. More info can be found here: https://lsadvising.berkeley.edu/policies/unit-ceiling-and-semester-limit

children.subject: Note that it's pretty common to enter at Sophomore/Junior level and still take 4 years to graduate - don't expect to necessarily have to graduate early

history.content:
Hey! I’m an incoming freshman (intended CS) with a lot of transferrable units through High School - Community College concurrent enrollment. After my units were transferred, in my portal, it’s showing that l now have a “Junior” level based on my units.

Does this mean I have to declare CS during my first semester? Will I have a semester limit in getting the degree? Also, how/when do I change my graduation date since my status has changed from Freshman to Junior?
history.subject: Change of Status--When to declare?
